intro: Xanthophytum polyanthum, commonly known as the golden flower of the Andes, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves adapted to arid conditions. The plant belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is known for its ability to store water in its thick leaves. Xanthophytum polyanthum thrives in rocky soils and is often found in alpine environments. Its unique botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
